attributes.action: Call for the government to actually take note of e petitions and to make effective change when possible
attributes.additional_details:
people create these e-petitions and whilst some may have people agreeing or disagreeing there are a few which hit the 100,000 signature mark and get a discussion in parliament yet nothing is actually done to sort out the problems or it is not sorted out to a real effect.

A big example of this is the e-petition fuel rises, the governments response was to drop it by 1p and now it has risen again (my local petrol pump is 4p more since november (when it was meant to go down 1p))

This e-petition is asking for the government to listen to britons for once and to make real effective changes that improve our day to day lives when lots of people show that they feel a certain way, and not to insult our intelligence by making a pathetic small change or none at all when we so badly want and need it.
